title: Perth man accused of killing 30-year-old Cara Hales declared fit to stand trial
text:
A 24-year-old man who was found naked and disorientated after allegedly murdering a woman he didn't know in semi-rural Perth will face trial.

Jesse John de Beaux is accused of killing Cara Hales, 30, at her Munster property on December 28, 2018.

A review of procedures at Graylands Hospital was ordered after de Beaux, a voluntary patient, reportedly left the facility the day before the fatal stabbing.

Jesse John de Beaux is accused of killing Cara Hales (pictured), 30, at her Munster property on December 28, 2018

De Beaux (pictured) reportedly left a mental health facility the day before he allegedly killed Ms Hales. A review was ordered into the mental health facility

North Metropolitan Health Service chief executive Robyn Lawrence would not comment on the case, but said day leave and community reintegration were part of a voluntary patient's clinical management plan.

Police notification was only required if there was a clinical risk to a voluntary patient or others, Dr Lawrence said.

'A thorough psychological assessment to determine a patient's risk to themselves and others is undertaken before a patient is granted leave or discharged by the treating mental health assessment team,' she said in a statement in January.

In January Ms Hales' friends and family honoured her during a funeral in Bunbury, The West Australian reported.

'It was never a dull moment when she was around, she was so beautiful inside and out and had the most contagious laugh and the most wild stories,' friend Mandy Goodwin said.

Bek Taylor, another friend, said she was grateful to have been able to call Ms Hales a friend.

De Beaux entered a not guilty plea in Stirling Gardens Magistrates Court on Wednesday after being declared fit to stand trial. His alleged victim is pictured

She said: 'Your huge smile, infectious laughter and ability to light up any room will be sorely missed but always warmly remembered,' she wrote.

Ms Hales's cousin Kym Smith said 'words can't describe how I'm feeling at the moment' when she shared her own tribute.

De Beaux entered a not guilty plea in Stirling Gardens Magistrates Court on Wednesday and will make his first Supreme Court appearance on January 20.
description: Jesse John de Beaux is accused of killing Cara Hales, 30, at her Munster, Perth, property on December 28, 2018.  He was declared fit to stand trial and entered a not guilty plea.
authors: Claudia Poposki For Daily Mail Australia
